result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert V Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: As to Case 15CF447, Count #1: the Court IMPOSES 10 years of Imprisonment consisting of 5 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years of Extended Supervision; to be served concurrent to sentences in 15CF360 and 15CF445 and other counts in 15CF447; the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Brown on Probation for a term of 5 years

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

---Mr. Brown is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

Cases 15CF360, 15CF445, 15CF447, and 16CF266 called together at 9:05am [ma]
Defendant Robert V Brown in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 16CF266:
--Atty. De La Rosa indicates waiting results from State Hygiene Lab; ADA Hall verifies that this is the status of the case. 
--the Court schedules this case for Preliminary Hearing.

As to Cases 15CF360, 15CF445, 15CF447, Sentencing occurs:
--sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: all remaining Counts of Cases 15CF360, 15CF445,15CF447

As to Case 15CF360, Count #1: the Court IMPOSES 18 months on Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision, the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Brown on Probation for a term of 3 years.

As to Case 15CF445, Count #1: the Court IMPOSES 6 years of Imprisonment consisting of 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision; to be served concurrent to sentences in 15CF360 and 15CF447 and other counts in 15CF445; the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Brown on Probation for a term of 3 years

As to Case 15CF445, Count #3: the Court IMPOSES 6 years of Imprisonment consisting of 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision; to be served concurrent to sentences in 15CF360 and 15CF447 and other counts in 15CF445; the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Brown on Probation for a term of 3 years

As to Case 15CF445, Count #7:the Court IMPOSES 6 years of Imprisonment consisting of 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision; to be served concurrent to sentences in 15CF360 and 15CF447 and other counts in 15CF445; the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Brown on Probation for a term of 3 years

As to Case 15CF447, Count #1: the Court IMPOSES 10 years of Imprisonment consisting of 5 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years of Extended Supervision; to be served concurrent to sentences in 15CF360 and 15CF445 and other counts in 15CF447; the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Brown on Probation for a term of 5 years

As to Case 15CF447, Count #2:the Court IMPOSES 6 years of Imprisonment consisting of 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision; to be served concurrent to sentences in 15CF360 and 15CF445 and other counts in 15CF447; the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Brown on Probation for a term of 5 years

As to Case 15CF447, Count #7:the Court IMPOSES 6 years of Imprisonment consisting of 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision; to be served concurrent to sentences in 15CF360 and 15CF445 and other counts in 15CF447; the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Brown on Probation for a term of 5 years

--As to Case 15CF447, Count #1: to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on     10/6/16 at  6:00pm.
---Mr. Brown is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

Cases 15CF445 & 15CF447 called together at 9:11 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert V Brown in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BOTH CASES:
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Brown waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--off-record: 9:14 - 9:15 am for Atty De La Rosa to confer with client
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Atty De La Rosa requests both cases be set for trial for 8/29-30/16 with FSSC on 8/23 at 10:30 as Mr. Brown has another matter set at that time
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending

Recess: 9:19 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES (1) FSSC scheduled for 8/23/16 at 10:30 am - Send notices (2) JT scheduled for 8/29-30/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Criminal Case Settlement

[MK] cases #15CF360, #15CF445, #15CF447 called at 10:42am. 
Defendant Robert V Brown in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Brown, verifying that he understands the form and joins in the agreement. 
recess 10:49am for Attorney De La Rosa and Mr. Brown to complete Preliminary Hearing waiver documents.
recess 11:02am
reconvene 11:48am. 
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Brown wishes to proceed to having Preliminary Hearings in Cases #15CF445 and #15CF447.
Because of this, Attorney De La Rosa is requesting adjournment of the Jury Trial scheduled for next week in Case #15CF360.
ADA Hall then realizes that the drugs have not yet been tested in Case #15CF360; there is not transmittal and no lab report in her file.
The Court adjourns the Jury Trial in Case #15CF360.
The Court reviews with Mr. Brown that the new Final Status-Scheduling Conference date of August 23rd if the final opportunity for any change of plea or other case resolution before proceeding to trial.
The Court continues Bond.
recess 11:54am.

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearings in Cases #15CF445 & #15CF447 on 6/3/16 at 8:30am;   and FSSC on 8/23/16 at 10:30and and Jury Trial on 8/29-8/30/16 (one day trial length is estimated) at 8:30am in Case #15CF360
Status conference on May 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Cases 15CF360, 15CF445, 15CF447 called together at 9:40am
Defendant Robert V Brown in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Cases 15CF447 and 15CF445 (initial appearance occurs):
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

As to Case 15CF360 (preliminary hearing occurs):
Officer Dan Hefty -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall 

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Brown committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--the State orally amends the Information to state 'a tin for preparation' in place of 'a syringe for injection'; the Court allow this amendment
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

As to Cases 15CF447 and 15CF445: 
Bond Arguments given by Counsel

As to Case 15CF447:
The Court requires a $2500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no possession of needles
--no contact with Katherine Santillano
--no presence at the residence of Katherine Santillano
--no possession of any financial cards not in own name

As to Case 15CF445:
The Court requires a $2500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no possession of needles
--no contact with Rose Brown
--no possession of any financial cards not in own name
recess:9:50am
